div.div: Great App!!
Pretty accurate as far as I can tell.
This is a great app for exercising and meeting personal health goals. I also like the accountability portion by inviting friends!

Love Map My Run. It has really helped me as I am a true beginner with running. The app tracks my progress and seeing how I do each time, how I am improving or days when I wasn't feeling into it has helped me get better. The only thing I wish it did was tell you when you were at other intervals like the half miles to help better my pace even more.

The free version is what every basic runner needs. Overall time, pace, distance, etc. I've been running for a while now on my own timing and distance estimation. That may have worked okay but if you really want to improve as an overall runner this app is for you. If I do have one dislike in this app it is that it doesn't do elevation. That would give it the final push it needs to be the "great" running app.
It is pretty helpful in figuring out distances but you have to run or walk to see how far it is

I use this every time I work out. I love that it syncs with My Fitness Pal. I wish that on your activity feed you could sort by type of activity instead of having to browse through all your entries. This would also be nice so you could see how you've been improving.

div.strong: Old guy back for fall & winterðŸ˜ŽðŸŒµ

div.div: # 1 went well ðŸ˜Ž
Great app. Does the job. No issues. Recommend.
Awesome
It worked pretty good at tracking distance and pace. Only issue was that i started running with 70% and before I hit a mile I was on 20% and that took less than 10 mins
Solid app I use it for all my runs but there should be a way for the voice to tell you half mile marks too

div.strong: Tried it out today, it was great!

div.div: First time using a running app so I may be easily impressed but it was good to be given my stats while running, and the routes were pretty well informed. Wish the music playing was better, I could only play my entire music library or nothing. It may be a feature for premium though, so I don't know
Nice to see that the mileage is now automatically entered when you choose the route. Now if only all my courses were downloaded to my phone from the desktop website. Keep up the good work!
Good but drains Iphone battery
I like this app. It is good. Thank you.

I've had this app for a while. It has all the features that I want. It's user friendly and informative. The only recommendation I would make is accuracy in distance. Other than that I highly recommend it.
I like all the features it offers and does a good job tracking my workouts.

I love this app. So glad I started using it. I stopped using my Garmin for every day runs. I'm unsure how accurate the pace is on this since it's a couple of seconds faster than my Garmin. Or maybe my Garmin isn't accurate.

Just used for first time in conjunction with C25K and iHeart radio. Tracked well and didn't interfere with other apps.
And I didn't pass out ... Yet.
Only giving four stars because I haven't used it but once!
This app is good for keeping track of distance, time, splits, etc. You also receive an email once a month with all of that information compiled so you can see what you've accomplished.
Love this app. It helps me improve my pace every day. I recently started running, I went from 21 mins a mile to 13!!
Good app for running. Sometimes distance can be glitchy in consistency.
I really like the app and how easy it is to use. GPS works great as well. The one thing I wish would be added is when walking, if there was a walking and pushing a stroller option.

div.strong: Convenient and super simple to use!

div.div: So simple to use. I wish it would update me each mile so I know if I am staying on target. It only tells you when you have hit the one mile mark past that you have to look at the phone to see when you hit your marks!

div.strong: Really only doing this cause they asked

div.div: Overall seems to be doing good, like that you can log your diet, like that it tracks my workouts should be a big help for my plan.
User friendly. Asks for feedback after every workout. Annoying, but what do you expect when it's free!
Love the app, use it to track my walking.
I love how it syncs songs workout info to my iPhone! Easy to use!
I've been using MapMyRUN for over three years and it is great to record my workouts and monitor my heart rate. I upgraded to mvp for the heart monitor and it works very good.
I recommend this app to anyone based on its ease of use.

So many different apps out there but this one provides everything you really need on a run.
Love being able to play my music, and as silly as they are, I love choosing those accomplishment badges!
Would be nice if I could connect my Spotify playlists to the app.

I'm just now getting familiar with the application. As such I can not give it a 5 quite yet. But what I can say is that it is offer more variety and interaction than say the Nike run app. In addition the fact that it syncs or works in conjunction with myfitnesspal is way cool. I'm looking forward to updates and learning the app more in depth.
Only used it once so it's a little soon to hand out five stars, but very well pleased with accuracy and set up. I really like that you can use your iTunes music very easily.
Gets the job done. Helps me keep track of the miles I walk with my dog.
Map my run works well. Haven't used the advanced features but overall it's good.
This free version gives me everything I need and works well. Delayed start, route, time, elevation, speed. I dig it and use it frequently.
Works great
Using it to train for LA in Feb. run/walk interval right now and it does a great job for me.
This app is fine for its basic functions. The only thing I want to do is track my distance and time and it works great for that.
Good tracking

I've been using MapMyRun go a little over a month now and I don't know how I ran without it. A college distance runner referred this app to me and I no use it on all my runs. It's quick and accurate. It lets you see you progress and helps to keep your workouts organized for training purposes. I defiantly recommend MapMyRun.
Great app! I recommend itðŸ‘ Let's me run and continues to track even when my phone goes to sleep.
Works well to record your progress and route when you don't know the course.
I only wish there was a way to track all the miles I walked in the airport during a long layover.
So far used it first time tonight and it's working fantastic even for nonnavigable area
A few flaws, but keeps good track of your run and records of past runs.
Love the app! Only thing I wish was that I could pause or stop the workout without unlocking my phone, but I don't even know if that's possible. Besides that it's great!

Great app for tracking miles and keeping pace. Good for running new routes as it calls out miles and pace. I wish it would call half miles and sometimes the accuracy is a little off. Overall it works great for me. I run 3-4 miles 4-5 days a week at an 8:20 per mi pace.
Everything you need for a good work out. Works great
